hint.text:
Pythagorean triplets can be expressed in general form as \(2m, (m^2-1) and (m^2+1)\)
In a Pythagorean triplet, \((2m)^2+(m^2-1)^2=(m^2+1)^2\)

solution.text:
The smallest member of the Pythagorean triplet is \(_{j}_\)
Let's take \(2m=_{j}_\)
Therefore, \(m=_{{j/2}}_\)
The other members \((m^2-1)\) and \((m^2+1)\) are \(_{{((j/2)**2)-1}}_\) and \(_{{((j/2)**2)+1}}_\) respectively.

content.text: In which \(_{j}_\) is the smallest member
